metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40023 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Sqlalchemy mako before 1.2.2 is vulnerable to Regular expression Denial ofService when using the Lexer class to parse. This also affects babelpluginand linguaplugin.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-mako - 1.0.7+ds1-1ubuntu0.2
python3-mako - 1.0.7+ds1-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mako package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.7+ds1-1ubuntu0.2').
